document.masterDocTitle: Revision of the genus Dziriblatta Chopard, 1936 (Blattodea, Ectobiidae, Ectobiinae) from North Africa, Spain, and the Macaronesian islands. I. The nine subgenera of the genus

Description. Size.
Length of pronotum in male 1.38–1.50 (mean 1.45) mm, in female 1.79–2.11 (mean 1.97) mm.
Male structures. See under characters of the subgenus.

Distribution. In the center of the High Atlas, between Taroudannt in the West and Demnate in the East, at altitudes between
1400 and 2800
m (Figs. 28, 29).

Remarks. Two of the male characters show locality dependent variation: The size of the glandular pores on T2 ( Figs. 6 G–I) and the presence ( Figs. 6D, E ) or absence ( Figs. 6A, B ) of a row of strong bristles on the preglandular margin of T7 near the opening of the pit. The distribution of the characters is shown on Table 1 . Large glandular pores are usually combined with the absence of large bristles, and small pores with the presence of larger bristles. But the occurrence of intermediate expressions in both characters ( Figs. 6F, C and 6H , respectively) does not allow a clear limitation between the different populations; a further subdivision of the taxon, therefore, appears inappropriate.
